eu.cqse.check.abap

Class CallSystemFunctionCheck

  • java.lang.Object
    • eu.cqse.check.framework.core.CheckImplementationBase
      • eu.cqse.check.base.EntityCheckBase
        • eu.cqse.check.abap.CallStatementCheckBase
          • eu.cqse.check.abap.CallSystemFunctionCheck

  • @ACheck(name="Suspicious usage of CALL system function",
        description="<p>The internal statement CALL <i>cfunc</i> executes a system function <i>cfunc</i>. Some system functions, e.g. \'SYSTEM\' or \'ThWpInfo\' allow to execute any command of the operating system and should be avoided. The <a href=\"https://help.sap.com/abapdocu_750/en/abenabap_system_commands_appl_sxpg.htm\">SXPG framework</a> should be used instead.</p>",
        groupName="Security",
        languages=ABAP,
        parameters=ABSTRACT_SYNTAX_TREE)
public class CallSystemFunctionCheck
extends CallStatementCheckBase
    Checks for usages of CALL cfunc - see ABAP keyword documentation. Names of functions are configurable by blacklist or whitelist. When CALL 'SYSTEM' is detected, allowed operating system commands can be specified in a specific whitelist.

    • Method Detail

      • isTargetedCallStatement

        protected boolean isTargetedCallStatement(ETokenType typeOfsecondToken)
        Determines if the call statement is the targeted kind of the CALL .... statement. Here, the test is if the second token must not be any of OTHER_CALL_TOKEN_TYPES. This specific list of other token types is used since checking only for literals and identifiers is not sufficient to cover also syntactic sugar, for example parentheses.
        Specified by:
        isTargetedCallStatement in class CallStatementCheckBase
        Parameters:
        typeOfsecondToken - type of token following the CALL keyword
        Returns:
        true if

      • processCallStatement

        protected void processCallStatement()
                             throws CheckException
        Processes the selected CALL ... statement entity. This method is only called from CallStatementCheckBase.processEntity(ShallowEntity) if the first token is the CALL keyword and the second token is of a type which is accepted by CallStatementCheckBase.isTargetedCallStatement(ETokenType).
        Specified by:
        processCallStatement in class CallStatementCheckBase
        Throws:
        CheckException
